p: Chronic illnesses such as type II diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, cancer and neurodegenerative disorders are the primary causes of disability and death all over the world. However, most of these diseases can be preventable or at least be delayed by lifestyle modifications, particularly by dietary changes [ 305]. It has been demonstrated that Piper species possess therapeutic and preventive potential against several chronic disorders. Among the functional properties of Piper plants, the antiproliferative ( Table 30), anti-inflammatory ( Table 31), and neuropharmacological activities ( Table 32 and Table 33) of the extracts and extract derived bioactive constituents are thought to be key effects for the protection against chronic conditions. The following sections reviewed the abovementioned functional biological activities of different Piper extracts/active components based on preclinical in vitro and in vivo studies, besides clinical studies ( Table 34).
